node.title: 'A dream come true': Unfancied Australia through to the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup
node.alt: Alicia Molik and Ajla Tomljanovic bump fists on the court
node.description: Australian pair Ajla Tomljanovic and Storm Sanders stand up to beat Belarus and advance to the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup.
node.content:
["Surprise packet Storm Sanders says helping\u00a0Australia to a\u00a0shock berth in the semi-finals of the Billie Jean King Cup \u2014\u00a0the World Cup of women's tennis \u2014\u00a0is like a \"dream come true\".", "Sanders scored her second singles triumph of the week in Prague, outclassing Belarus's Yuliya Hatouka 6-3, 6-3 in the opening match, before Ajla Tomljanovic earned a 4-6, 6-2, 6-3 comeback win over Aliaksandra Sasnovich to give Australia an unassailable lead in the crucial group tie.", "Sasnovich and Lidziya Marozava then won a consolation doubles against Ellen Perez and Olivia Gadecki 6-4, 6-4, but the Australians were left celebrating an overall 2-1 victory and\u00a0a last-four date on Friday against the winners of the Switzerland-Czech Republic tie.", "Despite missing the opening victory against Belgium with an unspecified illness, and with her thigh heavily strapped, world number 43 Tomljanovic proved resilient enough to beat 88-ranked\u00a0Sasnovich, but\u00a0had to dig deep after her first-set capitulation.", "\"There's no greater feeling,\" the 28-year-old said.", "\"The fact that I got a point makes me unbelievably happy. I just feel like I came here to help the team and ended up doing that, so that makes me happy.\"", "", "
Storm Sanders has been one of the surprise packets of the tournament.(Reuters: David W Cerny)
", "While Australia were understrength in the absence of world number one Ash Barty, Alicia Molik's team are now eyeing a chance\u00a0to go one better than their runner-up finish in 2019.", "\"It's the belief of the team I'm really impressed with,\" Molik said.", "\"Special tennis always comes out during the team events when we represent our country, so we can't wait for tomorrow. What a great opportunity.\"", "Belarus were without world number two Aryna Sabalenka and two-time grand slam champion Victoria Azarenka, but still, Australia faced no easy task.", "Sanders once again proved their inspiration.", "Enjoying her finest season yet on tour, the 27-year-old left-hander had set the ball rolling on Tuesday by defying her ranking of number 131 to score a huge three-set upset victory over world number 18 Elise Mertens 3-6, 7-6 (7-5), 6-0 to inspire a surprise win over Belgium.", "She had far too many guns for Hatouka, the world number 192 making her Cup debut, needing little more than an hour to put Australia in control.", "\"I was injured in 2018 with a shoulder injury and, honestly, I never thought I'd be playing singles for Australia in these finals,\" Sanders said.", "\"To have two wins as well \u2014\u00a0honestly it's a dream come true and I'm just really, really proud to be able to step out on court.\"", "Tomljanovic then recovered from her nervy, rusty start to clinch Australia's passage with the 30th win of a breakout season that\u00a0saw her make the Wimbledon quarter-finals.", "\"I don't think it really sinks in that we're in the semis because it's a different format this year,\" Tomljanovic said.", "\"I think we're all happy to be in the semis but no-one feels overly happy because we don't think the job is done yet.\"", "AAP"]
